etymology.description: 鬻(鬻) (yù, "congee") = 䰜(䰜) (lì, "cauldron") + 米(米) (mǐ, "rice") -> congee; 粥(粥) (zhōu, "porridge") is a reduced form of 鬻(鬻)
etymology.interpretation: The character 粥(粥) (zhōu, "porridge") was originally the character 鬻(鬻) (yù, "congee"), which depicted rice being cooked in a cauldron, symbolizing its usage as a food item. Over time, 粥(粥) became a simplified form for convenience.

examples.chinese: 他每天喝粥(他每天喝粥)。
我喜欢粥(我喜歡粥)，因为它很养胃(因爲它很養胃)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xǐhuān zhōu, yīnwèi tā hěn yǎngwèi.
examples.english: I like porridge because it is good for the stomach.

examples.chinese: 冬天里煮粥(冬天裡煮粥)，让人感到温暖(讓人感到溫暖)。
examples.pinyin: Dōngtiān lǐ zhǔ zhōu, ràng rén gǎndào wēnnuǎn.
examples.english: Cooking porridge in winter makes people feel warm.
